content.content: image2587×582 171 KB  Hi everyone, thanks for checking out the Weekly Relay! Whether you hold MKR or DAI, own a vault, or want to get more involved in governance, this is your one-stop-shop for MakerDAO updates.  Online PDF Version    Current Events  MakerDAO Votes to Disable Aave DAI Supply, Reducing Celsius Exposure MakerDAO Votes to Disable Aave DAI Supply, Reducing Celsius Exposure [Signal Request] Set the AAVE D3M DC to 0 (Zero) URGENT: Signal Request Set Aave D3M bar to 0% On June 14, GovAlpha submitted an urgent Signal Request in accordance with the MIP24c4 Urgent Response Procedure to disable the Aave DAI Direct Deposit Module (D3M), limiting Maker’s exposure to the precariously positioned Celsius exchange (check out last week’s Weekly Relay for an overview of the Celsius/stETH situation). The MakerDAO community passed the proposal on June 15, and it was executed on June 17.   twitter.com    Maker @MakerDAO  The Maker Governance has voted to temporarily disable the @AaveAave DAI Direct Deposit Module (D3M).  This change is available for execution on June 17 2022 21:03 UTC.  🗳 vote.makerdao.com/executive/temp…   11:34 PM - 15 Jun 2022           35                15            The proposal sets the Target Borrow Rate, or “bar,” to 0, preventing Celsius from taking out further loans. Celsius had borrowed 100M DAI using the de-pegged stETH token as collateral, while Maker only stood to take in 1.4% APY in revenue from this position. @Primoz and many other community members argued persuasively that this low revenue level does not offset the risks. The Risk Core Unit will reassess the situation and present their opinions—possibly including a recommendation to re-enable the Aave D3M—at the following MakerDAO Open Market Committee (MOMC) meeting in about one week.  The Endgame Party Delegate Signup The Endgame Party delegate signup The business-oriented scientific governance delegate signup As Rune continues to host the Open Decentralized Voter Committee calls, he recently introduced the Endgame Plan itself will have multiple stages of voting, including a preliminary Signal Request and the Endgame Plan Launch MIP. Additionally, Rune states that it will be beneficial and stabilizing to get a general understanding of the level of support for the Endgame Plan. As a result, Rune posted a thread where delegates can sign up to help run the Endgame Party. However, committed delegates are expected to attend as many Endgame Party Decentralized Voter Committees as possible, vote in general accordance with its direction, and contribute with information, ideas and proposals. Currently, the following recognized delegates have signed up and committed to the Endgame Plan:     Recognized Delegate Platform Signup Post     Doo Nam Platform Signup   JustinCase Platform Signup   3F Delegate LLC Platform Signup   Flipside Crypto Platform Signup   Penn Blockchain Platform Signup   Feedblack Loops LLC Platform Signup    Other recognized delegates, such as ChrisBlec, Mhonkasalo & teemulau, and MakerMan, have decided to support the Endgame vision while remaining independent to maintain their platform values and promote decentralized delegation. Furthermore, SebVentures has posted his own Delegate signup platform for a plan that is more business-oriented. His vision is simple: improving balance sheet allocation by investing in liquid tokens, lending against them, and promoting market making.  This Week in Governance Weekly MIPs Update #92  Executive Vote(s) Temporarily Disable the Aave DAI Direct Deposit Module (D3M) - June 15, 2022 This was an out-of-schedule executive proposal. It has been deployed and added to the voting portal in response to an urgent signal request that was posted on the recommendation of the Risk Core Unit (RISK-001) facilitator. This executive proposal passed and, as per this urgent signal request, the following changes occurred within the Maker Protocol:  The Aave DAI Direct Deposit Module (D3M) Target Borrow Rate (bar) was set to 0.  This change was proposed to disable the Aave D3M temporarily. Note that while setting the bar to 0 might intuitively suggest that the Aave D3M will utilize its entire debt ceiling, it is a pre-programmed state in the D3M code that will set the vault to unwind only.  Further details on this issue and the origin of this proposal can be found in the links below:  Risk Core Unit Analysis and Recommendation Further Risk Core Unit Analysis   On-Chain Polls Last week contained two active prioritization sentiment polls. Ten ratification polls were posted on June 20th, and one ratification poll was posted on June 21st, which makes up for a total of thirteen active on-chain polls.  Ratification Polls There are eleven active ratification polls you can still vote on:     Poll Name Discussion Start Date End Date     Ratification Poll for Onboard Growth Task Force (MIP75c3-SP1) Discussion Jun 14, 2022 16:49 UTC Jun 27, 2022 16:00   Ratification Poll for Facilitator Onboarding to IS-001 - Weekly Relay | June 7th - 13th, 2022 Hi everyone, thanks for checking out the Weekly Relay! Whether you hold MKR or DAI, own a vault, or want to get more involved in governance, this is your one-stop-shop for MakerDAO updates.  Online PDF Version    Current Events $stETH/ $ETH Peg in “Rough Shape” Celsius & MakerDAO The stETH token, issued to Lido Finance users to secure ETH after the merge, suffers from severe liquidity problems. At the time of this writing, Curve’s ETH/stETH pool is composed of nearly 80% stETH, and stETH is trading at a 5% discount against ETH. In short, the peg has broken. The Celsius Network, which as of June 10 held nearly 450k $stETH worth $1.5 billion, is facing a liquidity crisis due to the depeg and has frozen all withdrawals, swaps, and transfers. In addition to holding significant positions across major DeFi protocols, Celsius’ liquidity crisis directly contributes to today’s market crash. MakerDAO’s biggest debt holder, Celsius, has been consistently adding WBTC as collateral, which may compound the exchange’s problems if the market continues to decline.  The Endgame Plan part 3: The Endgame Decentralized Workforce @rune has published Part 3 of his Endgame Plan for revamping Maker governance.  Some of the goals outlined and the methods for achieving them include:  Making it easy for MKR holders to participate in decisions Focusing on dealing with the budget challenge Securing separation of powers via MetaDAOs Ensuring transparency and inclusion in all public interactions Open-sourcing frameworks are used to guide decisions and measure the results  The extensive post also discusses a new Budget Allocator role, the DAO2DAO paradigm, and several new types of Core Units, such as Supporting Core Units (SCUs), Administrative Core Units (ACUs), and Contributing Core Units (CCUs).). This post also briefly recaps the role of Decentralized Voter Committees in this proposed new governance system. All MKR holders can join Decentralized Voter Committees that promote impactful participation in governance on high-level topics and provide feedback to Delegates about MKR holders’ opinions. Keep an eye on the forums for announcements regarding the next Decentralized Voter Committee session.  Specialization Unlocks Complexity  …the complexity of Maker’s product has outgrown its brain.  Teej posted an alternative solution to Rune’s Endgame Plan’s Maker governance problems. Specifically, @teej is worried about:  Maker’s unmanageable complexity makes it nearly impossible for delegates to make informed decisions on every new proposal in Maker; and This complexity makes voter turnout low (about 9%).  As a solution, the post recommends that Maker governance be split into two primary groups: Governors and Clusters. Governors will focus on high-level strategic decisions around Maker’s goals and long-term vision, e.g.:  Should 20% of costs be cut in a bear market? Should a Core Unit’s budget be approved? Could MakerDAO onboard “unsecured” debt if it enhances DAI network effects while sacrificing “hardness”?   The Governors would be freed from operational issues related to hiring, firing, budgeting, etc., allowing them to focus on their core duties and keep up with DAO activities. To implement the high-level strategies outlined by the Governors, the Clusters will focus on executing the day-to-day tasks. A Cluster may consist of multiple Core Units. For example, RWA Clusters could include LTS, RWF, and CES. The Core Units should be given higher levels of autonomy to solidify the separation between high-level strategic decision-making and daily execution and take advantage of specialization’s known benefits. @teej believes this solution addresses many of the same issues as the Endgame Plan but in a less disruptive way.  This Week in Governance  Weekly MIPs Update  Ratification polls, proposals, and pre-MIP discussions.  Executive Vote(s) Parameter Changes, Starknet Bridge Limit and Authority Changes, Recognized Delegate Compensation, SH-001 Budget Distribution - June 08, 2022 This colossal executive proposal passed, and the following changes occurred within the Maker Protocol:  MOMC Parameter Changes     Parameter Vault Type Decreased / Increased Amount From → To     Maximum Debt Ceiling (line) WSTETH-A - 100 million DAI 300 million DAI → 200 million DAI   Maximum Debt Ceiling (line) DIRECT-AAVEV2-DAI - 200 million DAI 300 million DAI → 100 million DAI   Maximum Debt Ceiling (line) LINK-A - 50 million DAI 100 million DAI → 50 million DAI   Maximum Debt Ceiling (line) MANA-A + 5 million DAI 10 million DAI → 15 million DAI   D3M Target Borrow Rate (bar)  DIRECT-AAVEV2-DAI - 0.75% 3.5% → 2.75%   Target Available Debt (gap) WSTETH-B + 15 million DAI 15 million DAI → 30 million DAI      Maximum Debt Ceiling Reductions As per these governance polls (1, 2, 3, 4, 5), the following vault types had their Maximum Debt Ceiling (line) set to 0 DAI as the first-step of the collateral off-boarding process defined in MIP62:  UNI-A UNIV2DAIETH-A UNIV2WBTCETH-A UNIV2UNIETH-A UNIV2WBTCDAI-A   For more information, please see the original Signal Request on the forum here.   Starknet DAI Bridge Technical Changes As a result of this post from the StarkNet Engineering Core Unit (SNE-001), the following changes were made:  100,000 DAI increased the DAI Bridge Limit from 100,000 DAI to 200,000 DAI. Please note Maker Governance has already approved a DAI Bridge Limit of up to 5 million DAI in this governance poll.  DSChief was given control over L1EscrowMom. This change allows Maker Governance to shut down the Starknet Bridge via an Executive Vote without waiting for the GSM Pause Delay for the shutdown to take effect.  This was achieved by calling setAuthority(0x0a3f6849f78076aefaDf113F5BED87720274dDC0) on the L1EscrowMom contract.      Strategic Happiness Core Unit (SH-001) Budget Distribution As per their successful budget proposal, the following budget distributions took place for the Strategic Happiness Core Unit (SH-001):   230,000 DAI were transferred to the Strategic Happiness Core Unit (SH-001) at 0xc657aC882Fb2D6CcF521801da39e910F8519508d.  540,000 DAI will be streamed to the Strategic Happiness Core Unit (SH-001) at 0xc657aC882Fb2D6CcF521801da39e910F8519508d starting on 2022-06-01 and ending on 2023-03-15.  250 MKR will be streamed to the Strategic Happiness Core Unit (SH-001) at 0x955993Df48b0458A01cfB5fd7DF5F5DCa6443550 starting on 2022-06-01 and ending on 2026-06-01 with a cliff date of 2023-11-23.  Please note the address for the DAI budget distributions is different from the address listed in the budget proposal after the Core Unit Facilitator set up a multi-sig wallet for the Core Unit.  Please see this forum post for more details.   Recognized Delegate Compensation As per MIP61: Recognized Delegate Compensation, a total of 78,062 DAI were distributed to eleven Recognized Delegates as itemized below:     Delegate Amount Address     Flip Flop Flap Delegate LLC 12,000 DAI 0x688d508f3a6B0a377e266405A1583B3316f9A2B3   schuppi 12,000 DAI 0xCCffDBc38B1463847509dCD95e0D9AAf54D1c167   Feedblack Loops LLC 12,000 DAI 0x80882f2A36d49fC46C3c654F7f9cB9a2Bf0423e1   MakerMan 11,025 DAI 0x9AC6A6B24bCd789Fa59A175c0514f33255e1e6D0   ACREInvest 9,372 DAI 0x5b9C98e8A3D9Db6cd4B4B4C1F92D0A551D06F00D   JustinCase 7,626 DAI 0xE070c2dCfcf6C6409202A8a210f71D51dbAe9473   GFX Labs 6,607 DAI 0xa6e8772af29b29B9202a073f8E36f447689BEef6   monetsupply 6,275 DAI 0x4Bd73eeE3d0568Bb7C52DFCad7AD5d47Fff5E2CF   Doo 622 DAI 0x3B91eBDfBC4B78d778f62632a4004804AC5d2DB0   Flipside Crypto 270 DAI 0x62a43123FE71f9764f26554b3F5017627996816a   Penn Blockchain 265 DAI 0x070341aA5Ed571f0FB2c4a5641409B1A46b4961b     For further information, please see this forum post.  Governance Polls  Active Governance Polls There are three active governance polls:     Poll Name Discussion     Deploy a Trial Permissionless Open Market Operation Discussion   Management of Velodrome Airdrop and veNFT Discussion   Add rETH as a new Vault Type  Proposal Thread - Risk Core Unit Evaluation - Smart Contract Technical Assessment - Oracles Core Unit Evaluation       Ratification Polls There are eleven active ratification polls:     Poll Name Discussion     Ratification Poll for Facilitator Onboarding to IS-001 - @psychonaut (MIP41c4-SP34) Discussion   Ratification Poll for Facilitator Onboarding to DIN-001 - @tadeo (MIP41c4-SP35) Discussion   Ratification Poll for Adding Lending Oversight Core Unit (LOVE-001) Discussion   Ratification Poll for Task Forces (MIP75) Discussion   Ratification Poll for Onboard Growth Task Force (MIP75c3-SP1) Discussion   Ratification Poll for Adding a Special Purpose Fund - 2585×580 166 KB  Hi everyone, thanks for checking out the Weekly Relay! Whether you hold MKR or DAI, own a vault, or want to get more involved in governance, this is your one-stop shop for MakerDAO updates.  Online PDF Version    Current Events   Endgame Plan Discord Channel MakerDAO co-founder @rune has created a dedicated Discord channel for discussion about the Endgame Plan and designing an immutable future state for MakerDAO, improving governance dynamics and getting MKR holders more involved in the process, along with achieving other goals for success.  Sign up here to join the discussion. To catch up on the Endgame Plan, read rune’s original posts and our summaries of them:   Parts 1 and 2  Summary    Part 3  Summary    Part 4  Summary    Decentralized Voter Committees  Summary    @LongForWisdom also published a summary (Part 1, Part 2) of the Endgame Plan’s structure and goals, together with a useful index.  Ranked Choice Voting Discussion and Resources Flaw in the display of ranked-choice voting outcomes @lyt of the Strategic Finance Core Unit made a post pointing out an issue with the way ranked-choice voting results are displayed in the Maker Governance Voting Portal. Looking at the recently ended MIP40c3-SP69 poll about ratifying the Strategic Finance Core Unit Budget, @lyt points out that the “Approve increased budget” option appears to be far behind the “Approve existing budget only (business as usual)” option in terms of MKR backing, potentially discouraging voters from bothering to put their vote behind an option that looks to be all-but-defeated.  920×291 30.1 KB  In reality, however, due to the nature of ranked choice voting, the race was closer than it appeared. If the “Approve existing budget only” option had not reached the >50% threshold, any MKR backing the “Abstain” and (if the 50% threshold was still not reached by any of the leading contenders) “Reject budget” options would be redistributed to the “Approve existing budget only” and “Approve increased budget” options based on the voters’ second-rank votes. lyt is calling for an investigation into ways to display ranked-choice votes on the Maker Governance Voting Portal that better represent how close (or distant) a vote is. Patrick_J commented that he’d be contacting the DUX team shortly to present lyt’s criticisms. Prioritization Sentiment Poll Results Toward the end of last week’s Governance and Risk call, @prose11 provided information about how the voting breakdown currently stands for the open Prioritization Sentiment polls on Technical Resource Deployment and Collateral Class. These polls will make it easier for GovAlpha to put together a priority framework to ensure that MakerDAO and its Core Units are focusing their energy in the right places.      Technical Resource Deployment Current Results  921×387 38.9 KB  Collateral Class Current Results  921×387 43 KB  @tadeo of the Data Insights Core Unit also showed a tool for exploring and simulating ranked-choice Maker votes.  1782×579 145 KB   This Week in Governance   Weekly MIPs Update #93  Ratification polls, proposals, and pre-MIP discussions.  Executive Vote(s) This week’s Executive is still up on the portal, awaiting participation. You can vote until July 22, 2022, 14:18 UTC. MKR Vesting Transfers - June 22, 2022  DECO-001 MKR Transfer If this executive proposal passes, the following changes will occur within the Maker Protocol: As per their successful MKR vesting proposal, 500 MKR will be transferred to the Deco Fixed Rate Core Unit’s (DECO-001) auditor wallet.  RWF-001 MKR Transfer As per their successful MKR vesting proposal, 152 MKR will be transferred to the Real-World Finance Core Unit’s (RWF-001) auditor wallet. Note that the amount differs from the original proposal due to personnel changes within the Real-World Finance Core Unit. Also note that the distribution address has been amended to remain consistent with the budget implementation described in the most recent Real-World Finance Core Unit DAI budget proposal.
